            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Department of Environment and Climate Change (ECC) is responsible for monitoring transboundary waters to ensure that upstream provinces and territories are not causing downstream effects in the Northwest Territories (NWT). The Transboundary suspended sediment and water quality sampling sites were established to characterize the water quality in the major transboundary rivers flowing into the NWT. The transboundary rivers monitored under this program are the Slave, Hay, Liard and Peel Rivers.The comprehensive program has developed a solid baseline for the aquatic ecosystem of these rivers against which future changes can be measured.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

fr: Rivières transfrontalières des Territoires du Nord-Ouest
Conseil du bassin du fleuve Mackenzie

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-429b-qn70
notes: The Department of Environment and Climate Change (ECC) is responsible for monitoring transboundary waters to ensure that upstream provinces and territories are not causing downstream effects in the Northwest Territories (NWT). The Transboundary suspended sediment and water quality sampling sites were established to characterize the water quality in the major transboundary rivers flowing into the NWT. The transboundary rivers monitored under this program are the Slave, Hay, Liard and Peel Rivers.The comprehensive program has developed a solid baseline for the aquatic ecosystem of these rivers against which future changes can be measured.

notes_translated.en: The Department of Environment and Climate Change (ECC) is responsible for monitoring transboundary waters to ensure that upstream provinces and territories are not causing downstream effects in the Northwest Territories (NWT). The Transboundary suspended sediment and water quality sampling sites were established to characterize the water quality in the major transboundary rivers flowing into the NWT. The transboundary rivers monitored under this program are the Slave, Hay, Liard and Peel Rivers.The comprehensive program has developed a solid baseline for the aquatic ecosystem of these rivers against which future changes can be measured.
notes_translated.fr: Le ministère de l'Environnement et du Changement climatique (ECC) est chargé de surveiller les eaux transfrontalières afin de s'assurer que les provinces et les territoires en amont n'ont pas d'effets en aval dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest (TNO). Les sites d'échantillonnage transfrontaliers des sédiments en suspension et de la qualité de l'eau ont été établis pour caractériser la qualité de l'eau dans les principaux cours d'eau transfrontaliers qui se jettent dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest. Les rivières transfrontalières surveillées dans le cadre de ce programme sont les rivières Slave, Hay, Liard et Peel. Le programme complet a permis de développer une base de référence solide pour l'écosystème aquatique de ces rivières par rapport à laquelle les changements futurs peuvent être mesurés.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Transboundary Rivers Water Quality Monitoring Program

title_translated.en: Transboundary Rivers Water Quality Monitoring Program
title_translated.fr: Programme de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau des rivières transfrontalières

title_translation_method.fr: Title text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate
